item.title: 情報筋ディズニーは、ボブ・アイガーCEOの最終的な後継者探しで、部門責任者のダナ・ウォルデン、ジミー・ピタロ、ジョシュ・ダマロ、アラン・バーグマンに注目している（Bloomberg）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Disney is focusing on divisional heads Dana Walden, Jimmy Pitaro, Josh D'Amaro, and Alan Bergman in a search for an eventual successor to CEO Bob Iger  —  Walt Disney Co.'s board is focusing on four divisional heads as part of a formal search for an eventual successor …

item.title: 申請中：パラマウント・グローバルがインドのメディア企業Viacom18の株式13％をリライアンスに5億1700万ドルで売却することで合意、リライアンスの持ち株比率は70.49％に上昇（Manish Singh/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Manish Singh / TechCrunch:
Filing: Paramount Global has agreed to sell its 13% stake in Indian media house Viacom18 to Reliance for $517M, raising Reliance's stake to 70.49%  —  Paramount Global has reached a binding agreement to sell its 13% stake in Reliance-controlled Indian media firm Viacom18 to Reliance for $517 million, both companies said Wednesday.

item.title: 情報筋ドン・レモンは、イーロン・マスクが契約を破棄するまでは、厳密にはXとの契約を結んでいなかった。レモンは3月18日にマスクとのインタビューをYouTubeに掲載する予定（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: Don Lemon had not technically inked an X contract before Elon Musk killed the deal; Lemon plans to post his interview with Musk on March 18 on YouTube  —  The Scoop  —  Elon Musk and Don Lemon are escalating towards what could be a bitter contract dispute after X's owner abruptly terminated …

item.title: クレムリン系のRIAノーボスチによると、ロシアは放送局Dozhdの元EICであるミハイル・ザイガルをロシア軍の残虐行為に関する「フェイクニュース」を広めた罪で起訴した（モスクワ・タイムズ）。
item.description:
The Moscow Times:
Kremlin-linked RIA Novosti says Russia has charged Mikhail Zygar, former EIC of broadcaster Dozhd, with spreading “fake news” about Russian army atrocities  —  Russian authorities have pressed criminal charges against journalist Mikhail Zygar for spreading “fake news” …

item.title: ナショナル・トラスト・フォー・ローカル・ニュースは中古の印刷機を購入し、コロラド・コミュニティ・メディアの新聞の印刷を担当するためにデンバーに移動させる計画だ（Corey Hutchins/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Corey Hutchins / Nieman Lab:
The National Trust for Local News bought a used printing press and plans to move it to Denver to handle printing for Colorado Community Media's newspapers  —  “Demand has gone down for printed newspapers, but the supply chain for providing newspapers in a printed format is collapsing faster …

item.title: 米下院は、アプリの販売または禁止を強制する超党派のTikTok法案を可決。同法案は、同伴法案のない上院の先行きは不透明だ（Cristiano Lima-Strong/Washington Post）
item.description:
Cristiano Lima-Strong / Washington Post:
The US House passes a bipartisan TikTok bill that forces a sale or ban of the app; the legislation faces an uncertain Senate path without a companion measure  —  The swift rebuke shifts attention to the Senate, where the bill faces significant political barriers and constitutional concerns

item.title: OpenAIがLe MondeとPrisa Mediaとの提携を発表、フランス語とスペイン語のニュースコンテンツをChatGPTに提供し、OpenAIのモデルのトレーニングを支援（Shirin Ghaffary/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Shirin Ghaffary / Bloomberg:
OpenAI announces partnerships with Le Monde and Prisa Media to bring French and Spanish language news content to ChatGPT and help train OpenAI's models  —  The startup has made a global effort to reach licensing agreements with publishers.  —  OpenAI has inked licensing deals …

item.title: ケイト・ミドルトンの病気療養中の取材をめぐる英国メディアの極端な嗜好は、メーガン・マークル報道における二重基準を浮き彫りにしている（Zeynep Tufekci/New York Times）
item.description:
Zeynep Tufekci / New York Times:
The UK media's extreme deference over covering Kate Middleton during her medical absence highlights its double standards in its Meghan Markle coverage  —  “Where Is Kate Middleton?” yet another headline blared on Monday.  The public speculation following her unspecified abdominal surgery …

item.title: アルゼンチンの極右政府、INCAAの予算が400万ドル不足していると主張し、国家助成金削減計画を推進（Zac Ntim/Deadline）
item.description:
Zac Ntim / Deadline:
Argentina's far-right government claims to have found a $4M deficit in the INCAA film body's budget and pushes through controversial plans to cut state funding  —  The government of Javier Milei, Argentina's far-right leader, has pushed through highly controversial plans to defund all state funding …

item.title: ドン・レモンは、イーロン・マスクが「ドン・レモン・ショー」とXとの提携をキャンセルしたと語った。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Don Lemon says Elon Musk canceled The Don Lemon Show's partnership with X, hours after taping an interview with Musk on March 8 for the show's debut episode  —  The former CNN host interviewed the tech mogul last week, with the chat set to be the launch episode of his new ‘Don Lemon Show.’

item.title: YouTubeがTVアプリを刷新、視聴体験をよりインタラクティブにし、チャプター、コメント、動画の説明をより目立たせる（Chris Welch/The Verge）
item.description:
Chris Welch / The Verge:
YouTube revamps its TV app to make the viewing experience more interactive and giving greater prominence to chapters, comments, and video descriptions  —  YouTube is constantly tinkering with its app design across different platforms and screen sizes, and today, the company shared the latest changes coming to its TV-optimized app.

item.title: 英国は、英国の新聞・雑誌の「外国国家による所有、影響、支配を禁止する」法案を計画しており、レッドバードによるテレグラフ買収を阻止できる可能性がある（Jane Croft/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Jane Croft / The Guardian:
The UK plans legislation to “ban foreign state ownership, influence, or control” of UK newspapers and magazines, which could thwart Redbird's Telegraph takeover  —  New legislation could thwart planned £600m purchase of newspaper group by UAE-backed consortium

item.title: 米下院、アプリの販売または禁止を強制する超党派のTikTok法案を可決。
item.description:
Washington Post:
The US House passes a bipartisan TikTok bill that forces a sale or ban of the app; the legislation faces an uncertain Senate path without a companion measure  —  The House vote, set for Wednesday, is expected to mark the first time a chamber of Congress has passed legislation that could lead to a ban of a social media platform.

item.title: EU議会、報道機関を不当な影響から保護し、多元主義を育成し、透明性要件を導入する「メディアの自由法」などを承認（Mathieu Pollet/Politico）
item.description:
Mathieu Pollet / Politico:
The EU Parliament approves the Media Freedom Act, to shield newsrooms from undue influence, foster pluralism, introduce transparency requirements, and more  —  The new law will ban governments from going after journalists to reveal their sources by deploying spyware on their phones.
